intro: Diapedium sparsiflorum, commonly known as the sparsiflorous diapedium, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent, elongated stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
